decoding=\'async\' height=\'72\' src=\'data:image/svg+xml;base64,\' title=\'Italy Bans Chinese DeepSeek AI Over Data Privacy and Ethical Concerns\' width=\'72\'/> </figure> </div> <div class=\'pop-desc\'> <div class=\'pop-title\'>Italy Bans Chinese DeepSeek AI Over Data Privacy and Ethical Concerns</div> </div> </a> </div> <div class=\'cf pop-article clear last-three\'> <a class=\'pop-link cf\' href="https://thehackernews.com/2025/02/us-and-dutch-authorities-dismantle-39.html"> <div class=\'side-pop-image\'> <figure class=\'pop-image\'> <img alt=\'U.S. and Dutch Authorities Dismantle 39 Domains Linked to BEC Fraud Network\' border=\'0\' class=\'lazyload\' data-src=\'https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEiRZTLjGDImwINlCl8Laz5n7taKv-ulvZcF_3pBptLp4p4Nzja0kTPPP_J1u3N7GjszXsmMt1U3GpEXG9YtIF0qaA6-eadRsPQi-jaREAf6jszwmCUdtu1qsLVH7kdoH78gDDX122UKcYVAHAgUcsRvZT7qlQPrkh1ekcvpRWSc0uLZLvlFu8rd8bZwbh0m/w72-h72-p-k-no-nu/fbi.png\' Now give the factsheet for the following information:  Cybercriminals have been observed using legitimate HTTP client toolsincluding Go Resty and Node Fetchto conduct account takeover (ATO) attacks on Microsoft 365 environments.\n\n Since June 9, 2024, a password spraying campaign utilizing these tools has recorded approximately 13 million login attempts, averaging over 66,000 malicious attempts per day.\n\n Despite the high volume of attempts, the overall success rate remained low, impacting only 2% of the targeted entities.\n\n More than 178,000 user accounts across 3,000 organizations have been identified as targeted, with the education sector (particularly student accounts) comprising a significant portion of these affected accounts.\n\n Aside from Go Resty and Node Fetch, a variety of HTTP client tools (such as Axios and Python Requests) are being leveragedAxios in particular is paired with platforms like Evilginx to capture credentials and MFA codes.\n\n Over time, attackers have evolved their tactics; earlier campaigns (dating back to February 2018) used OkHttp variants, but by March 2024, a broader range of HTTP client tools came into use, peaking in May 2024 with attacks supported by millions of hijacked residential IPs.\n\n Threat actors are not only using these tools for brute-force password spraying but are also setting up new mailbox rules, stealing sensitive data, and registering OAuth applications with excessive permissions to maintain persistent access.\n\n Security researcher Anna Akselevich noted that these tools, originally sourced from public repositories like GitHub, enhance the efficiency of attacksallowing adversaries to switch between different HTTP clients and incorporate advanced techniques such as adversary-in-the-middle (AitM) to further compromise targets.'}], 'model': 'gpt-3.5-turbo-16k'}}

.sharebelow-comment {width:auto} .sharebelow-facebook,.sharebelow-comment {display:inline-block}  .f-menu-cl-1,.f-menu-cl-2,.f-menu-cl-3 {width:33.33%} .f-menu-cl-3 {display:block} .f-menu-cl-4 data-src=\'https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEjx2cij7Zn_6jyxVOFUQZbJbb2JTi4ET4hn1qvv6YJI6WBbqOST0FE4F-BthBp7vTkOaP6sCiKkodkcm166yEXmR-_bNspTHdojFi3LAhmyaDjZjpqOi4qSDkJY7j8Hy0oh8iE6PqLaVh_K8sh3a8kcwJOPU-hjyeT6tqvNfxY6qYX3SqFW611E6aoadZz_/s728-rw-e100/devsecops-wiz-d.png\' height=\'91\' loading=\'lazy\' src=\'data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAEAAAABCAQAAAC1HAwCAAAAC0lEQVR42mP8Xw8AAoMBgDTD2qgAAAAASUVORK5CYII=\' width=\'729\'/></a> </div> </div> <main class=\'main clear\'> <div class=\'main-box clear\'> <!--Item Page--> <h1 class=\'story-title\'><a href="https://thehackernews.com/2025/02/cybercriminals-use-axios-and-node-fetch.html">Cybercriminals Use Go Resty and Node Fetch in 13 Million Password Spraying Attempts</a></h1> <div class=\'main-left-right clear\'> <div class=\'left-box\' id=\'left-box\'> <div class=\'content section\' id=\'content\'><div class=\'widget Blog\' data-version=\'1\' id=\'Blog1\'> <div class=\'blog-posts clear\'> <div class=\'post\'> <div class=\'post-body\' itemscope=\'\' itemtype=\'https://schema.org/NewsArticle\'> <link href="https://thehackernews.com/2025/02/cybercriminals-use-axios-and-node-fetch.html" itemprop=\'mainEntityOfPage url\' /> <meta content=\'Cybercriminals Use Go Resty and Node Fetch in 13 Million Password Spraying Attempts\' itemprop=\'headline\'/> <meta content=\'en-US\' itemprop=\'inLanguage\'/> <meta content=\'2025-02-05T18:33:00+05:30\' itemprop=\'datePublished\'/> <meta content=\'2025-02-05T13:08:36Z\' itemprop=\'dateModified\'/> <div itemprop=\'image\' itemscope=\'\' itemtype=\'https://schema.org/ImageObject\'><meta content=\'https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEjYcB32bkzUF1AUr0lZ-QhdBoLLvnT73Shfa_xeGfbzGcBDUBqpyPKsM8S2JQTYp2QPGEz9VYJtSjJQyPoaq62xn45twN9602Yhyphenhyphen2oaCfmumyoGw_m7b9zmIzDVJ4rtwEIe7veBBkkObIMddQ2IOKjt81JpF3aCJmPHikqQqDQwGUOk2Z3KPxOrkKRfKHDg/s728-rw-e365/pssword.png\' itemprop=\'url\'/><meta content=\'728\' itemprop=\'width\'/><meta content=\'380\' itemprop=\'height\'/></div> <div itemprop=\'publisher\' itemscope=\'\' itemtype=\'https://schema.org/Organization\'><meta content=\'The Hacker News\' itemprop=\'name\'/><meta content=\'https://thehackernews.com/\' itemprop=\'url\'/><div content=\'https://thehackernews.com/images/-lr1jzOJlY3g/Wzjug8yO0UI/AAAAAAAAxSk/pVpxFhgIHRcIbASdYo3YSDZLB8p3ytjqACLcBGAs/s460-rw-e365/the-hacker-news.jpg\' itemprop=\'logo\' itemscope=\'\' itemtype=\'https://schema.org/ImageObject\'><meta content=\'https://thehackernews.com/images/-lr1jzOJlY3g/Wzjug8yO0UI/AAAAAAAAxSk/pVpxFhgIHRcIbASdYo3YSDZLB8p3ytjqACLcBGAs/s460-rw-e365/the-hacker-news.jpg\' itemprop=\'url\'/><meta content=\'460\' itemprop=\'width\'/><meta content=\'60\' itemprop=\'height\'/></div></div> <div itemprop=\'author\' itemscope=\'\' itemtype=\'https://schema.org/Person\'><meta content=\'Ravie Lakshmanan\' itemprop=\'name\'/><meta content=\'https://twitter.com/thehackersnews\' itemprop=\'url\'/></div> <div class=\'clear post-head\'> <div class=\'postmeta\'><span class=\'p-author\'><i class=\'icon-font icon-calendar\'>&#59394;</i><span class=\'author\'>Feb 05, 2025</span><i class=\'icon-font icon-user\'>&#59396;</i><span class=\'author\'>Ravie Lakshmanan</span></span><span class=\'p-tags\'>Cybersecurity / Cloud Security</span></div></div> <div class=\'articlebody clear cf\' id=\'articlebody\'><div class="separator" style="clear: both;"><a href="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEjYcB32bkzUF1AUr0lZ-QhdBoLLvnT73Shfa_xeGfbzGcBDUBqpyPKsM8S2JQTYp2QPGEz9VYJtSjJQyPoaq62xn45twN9602Yhyphenhyphen2oaCfmumyoGw_m7b9zmIzDVJ4rtwEIe7veBBkkObIMddQ2IOKjt81JpF3aCJmPHikqQqDQwGUOk2Z3KPxOrkKRfKHDg/s728-rw-e365/pssword.png" style="display: block;  text-align: center; clear: left; float: left;"><img data-src="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEjYcB32bkzUF1AUr0lZ-QhdBoLLvnT73Shfa_xeGfbzGcBDUBqpyPKsM8S2JQTYp2QPGEz9VYJtSjJQyPoaq62xn45twN9602Yhyphenhyphen2oaCfmumyoGw_m7b9zmIzDVJ4rtwEIe7veBBkkObIMddQ2IOKjt81JpF3aCJmPHikqQqDQwGUOk2Z3KPxOrkKRfKHDg/s728-rw-e365/pssword.png" src="data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAEAAAABCAQAAAC1HAwCAAAAC0lEQVR42mP8Xw8AAoMBgDTD2qgAAAAASUVORK5CYII=" alt="" border="0" data-original-height="380" data-original-width="728" /></a></div>  <p>Cybercriminals are increasingly leveraging legitimate HTTP client tools to facilitate account takeover (ATO) attacks on Microsoft 365 environments.</p> <p>Enterprise security company Proofpoint said it observed campaigns using HTTP clients Axios and Node Fetch to send HTTP requests and receive HTTP responses from web servers with the goal of conducting ATO attacks.</p> <p>"Originally sourced from public repositories like GitHub, these tools are increasingly used in attacks like Adversary-in-the-Middle (AitM) and brute force techniques, leading to numerous account takeover (ATO) incidents," security researcher Anna Akselevich <a href="https://www.proofpoint.com/us/blog/threat-insight/http-client-tools-exploitation-account-takeover-attacks" rel="noopener" target="_blank">said</a>.</p> <div class=\'dog_two clear\'><center class=\'cf\'><a href=\'https://thehackernews.uk/encrypted-attacks-report-d\' rel=\'nofollow noopener sponsored\' target=\'_blank\' title=\'Cybersecurity\'><img class=\'lazyload\' alt="Cybersecurity" src="data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAEAAAABCAQAAAC1HAwCAAAAC0lEQVR42mP8Xw8AAoMBgDTD2qgAAAAASUVORK5CYII=" data-src="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEh6e4c8i_pkXRCFnrtqVIygOrARiVnU3_KUgU5mhPl5V4uj8R1KcQOxRLdZ0xm1Rf5AX_cviUAeiiRkTJCe8HXzOeB363590NBXAMv92N9e7zr4m7aKtDq-Q_gpP9QFWecL0oxcVtmqSg9qrGEGqlDbzwNNFKGJe2nlup4tuL7AZzTm0U501YxPGodOc2Fq/s728-rw-e100/zz-d.jpg" width="727" height="90"/></a></center></div> <p>The use of HTTP client tools for brute-force attacks has been a long-observed trend since at least February 2018, with successive iterations employing variants of OkHttp clients to target Microsoft 365 environments at least until early 2024.</p> <p>But by March 2024, Proofpoint said it began to observe a wide range of HTTP clients gaining traction, with the attacks scaling a new high such that 78% of Microsoft 365 tenants were targeted at least once by an ATO attempt by the second half of last year.</p> <p>"In May 2024, these attacks peaked, leveraging millions of hijacked residential IPs to target cloud accounts," Akselevich said.</p> <p>The volume and diversity of these attack attempts is evidenced by the emergence of HTTP clients such as Axios, Go Resty, Node Fetch, and Python Requests, with those combining precision targeting with AitM techniques achieving a higher compromise rate.</p> <p>Axios, per Proofpoint, is designed for Node.js and browsers and can be paired with AitM platforms like Evilginx to enable theft of credentials and multi-factor authentication (MFA) codes.</p> <p>The threat actors have also been observed setting up new mailbox rules to conceal evidence of malicious activities, stealing sensitive data, and even registering a new OAuth application with excessive permission scopes to establish persistent remote access to the compromised environment.</p> <p>The Axios campaign is said to have primarily singled out high-value targets like executives, financial officers, account managers, and operational staff across transportation, construction, finance, IT, and healthcare verticals.</p> <p>Over 51% of the targeted organizations have been assessed to be successfully impacted between June and November 2024, compromising 43% of targeted user accounts.</p> <div class=\'dog_two clear\'><center class=\'cf\'><a href=\'https://thehackernews.uk/saas-security-v2-d\' rel=\'nofollow noopener sponsored\' target=\'_blank\' title=\'Cybersecurity\'><img class=\'lazyload\' alt="Cybersecurity" src="data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAEAAAABCAQAAAC1HAwCAAAAC0lEQVR42mP8Xw8AAoMBgDTD2qgAAAAASUVORK5CYII=" data-src="https://blogger.googleusercontent.com/img/b/R29vZ2xl/AVvXsEhT2OnXk97z-adL5WBKzz6wsA7vAhygg3Px0VPmqpH5hH4AErnYajTCpDN7SLy43ejD_T4Skv8OMOdG9qpzMfihrj8o7qSznLKA8zg7jW8L4hY8-umwTNZSpAj0JvtG3VGMFGw9n7hMyea1NpVSXp6yTaClLUQ3GujxwlEuLmQFSsVH28WQy6vp-cOGG0p_/s728-rw-e100/saas-security-v2-d.png" width="727" height="90"/></a></center></div> <p>The cybersecurity company said it also detected a large-scale password spraying campaign using Node Fetch and Go Resty clients, recording no less than 13 million login attempts since June 9, 2024, averaging over 66,000 malicious attempts per day. The success rate, however, remained low, affecting only 2% of targeted entities.</p> <p>More than 178,000 targeted user accounts across 3,000 organizations have been identified to date, a majority of which belong to the education sector, particularly student user accounts that are likely to be less protected and can be weaponized for other campaigns or sold to different threat actors.</p> <p>"Threat actors\' tools for ATO attacks have greatly evolved, with various HTTP client tools used for exploiting APIs and making HTTP requests," Akselevich said. "These tools offer distinct advantages, making attacks more efficient."</p> <p>"Given this trend, attackers are likely to continue switching between HTTP client tools, adapting strategies to leverage new technologies and evade detection, reflecting a broader pattern of constant evolution to enhance their effectiveness and minimize exposure."</p> <br/> <div class=\'stophere\' id=\'hiddenH1\'></div> <div class=\'cf note-b\'>Found this article interesting?  Follow us on <a href=\'https://twitter.com/thehackersnews\' rel=\'noopener\' target=\'_blank\'>Twitter <i class=\'icon-font icon-twitter\'>&#61593;</i></a> and <a href=\'https://www.linkedin.com/company/thehackernews/\' rel=\'noopener\' target=\'_blank\'>LinkedIn</a> to read more exclusive content we post.</div> </div> <script data-cfasync=\'false\'> var
